griffon.swing.formatters

Class ColorFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • griffon.core.formatters.AbstractFormatter<Color>
      • griffon.swing.formatters.ColorFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Formatter<Color>

    public class ColorFormatter
extends AbstractFormatter<Color>

    A Formatter that can parse Strings into java.awt.Color and back using several patterns

    Supported patterns are:

    • #RGB
    • #RGBA
    • #RRGGBB
    • #RRGGBBAA
    Where each letter stands for a particular color components in hexadecimal
    • R - red
    • G - green
    • B - blue
    • A - alpha

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Andres Almiray
    See Also:
    Formatter

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        @Nonnull
public static ColorFormatter getInstance(@Nullable
                                 String pattern)

        Returns a ColorFormatter given a color pattern.

        Parameters:
        pattern - the input pattern. Must be one of the 4 supported color patterns.
        Returns:
        a ColorPattern instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied pattern is not supported

      • format

        @Nullable
public String format(@Nullable
                     Color color)
        Description copied from interface: Formatter

        Formats an instance into its literal representation.

        The resulting String may be set as an argument to Formatter.parse(java.lang.String) resulting in a similar instance as the input.

        Parameters:
        color - the instance to be formatted
        Returns:
        A String representing the instance's state.

      • parse

        @Nullable
public Color parse(@Nullable
                   String str)
            throws ParseException
        Description copied from interface: Formatter

        Parses a literal representation into an instance of type T.

        The resulting instance T may be set as an argument to Formatter.format(T) resulting in an equal String as the input.

        Parameters:
        str - the String to be parsed
        Returns:
        an instance of type T whose state is initialized given the parameters of the input String.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the String cannot be parsed.

      • getPattern

        @Nonnull
public String getPattern()
        Returns the pattern used by this ColorFormatter
        Returns:
        the pattern this ColorFormatter uses for parsing/formatting.

      • parseColor

        @Nonnull
public static Color parseColor(@Nonnull
                       String str)
                        throws ParseException

        Parses a string into a java.awt.Color instance.

        The parsing pattern is chosen given the length of the input string

        • 4 - #RGB
        • 5 - #RGBA
        • 7 - #RRGGBB
        • 9 - #RRGGBBAA

        The input string may also be any of the Color constants identified by griffon.swing.support.Colors.
        Parameters:
        str - the string representation of a java.awt.Color
        Returns:
        a java.awt.Color instance matching the supplied RGBA color components
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the string cannot be parsed by the chosen pattern
        See Also:
        Colors
